name: Sea Holly
climate: Sea holly thrives in temperate regions, often found near coastal areas.
It can tolerate tough climates but prefers mild environments.
Hardy in zones where winter temperatures donâ€™t drop too drastically.
Resistant to drought conditions, making it ideal for xeriscaping.
sunlight: Sea holly requires full sunlight to grow and bloom effectively.
It is best planted in locations receiving at least six hours of sun daily.
Partial shade can hinder flowering and growth efficiency.
Optimal growth occurs in unobstructed locations with ample daylight.
watering: Sea holly is drought tolerant and requires minimal water once established.
Overwatering can lead to root rot and is not advised for sea holly plants.
Weekly watering should suffice during prolonged dry spells in summer.
Ensure soil dries out between waterings to prevent waterlogged conditions.
soil: Well-drained soil is crucial for sea holly, preventing water stagnation.
Prefers sandy or rocky soil types that mimic its native habitat.
Enriched, loamy soils are not necessary and can reduce plant vigor.
Soil pH levels ranging from nearly neutral to slightly alkaline are ideal.
extra_care_tip: Cut back stems in late winter before new growth begins for a tidy appearance.
Remove spent flowers to encourage continued blooming throughout the growing season.
